intro: Schnella angulosa var. bahiana, commonly known as the Bahian angular snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive angular stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation.
